text: As per Jean-Jacques Rousseau, civil religion is the foundation that keeps modern society together. It provides the state with sacred authority. In his book The Social Contract Rousseau states the dogma of civil religion: # Deity # life to come # the reward of virtue and the punishment of vice # the exclusion of religious intolerance. p. 30 p. 245 p. 29 ==References== Category:Political science Category:Sociology of religion
title: Civil religion
